did.unittitle: Indiana University Bureau of Evaluative Studies and Testing publications

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: Indiana University, Bloomington. Bureau of Evaluative Studies and Testing.

did.abstract: A result of amalgamations of School of Education research divisions, the Bureau of Educational Studies and Testing began at Indiana University in the 1960s. In 1977, its name changed to the Bureau of Evaluative Studies and Testing and more recently, is known as Educational Services and Testing and is part of the university's Instructional Support Services. The collection consists of twenty-two published monographic studies and a list of all monograph studies published by the bureau from 1963-1987.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open for research. Advance notice required.

bioghist.head: Administrative History
bioghist.p: A result of amalgamations of School of Education research divisions, the Bureau of Educational Studies and Testing began at Indiana University in the 1960s. In 1977, its name changed to the Bureau of Evaluative Studies and Testing and more recently, is known as Educational Services and Testing and is part of the university's Instructional Support Services. The bureau acted as a university-wide applied research and evaluation service center and measured various aspects of university and student performance as related to education. The Bureau of Educational Studies and Testing undertook research endeavors, held conferences, and circulated relevant evaluative information to university faculty and staff.

One of the Bureau's objectives was to conduct studies in the prediction and evaluation of student behavior; beginning in 1963, the findings of these studies were subsequently published as pamphlet monographs under the series title Indiana Studies in Prediction. In 1977, the bureau changed its name to the "Bureau of Evaluative Studies and Testing", and began publishing its studies under the series title Indiana Studies in Higher Education.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Collection is organized in a single series: Publications.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of a single series, Publications (1969-1987), which includes twenty-two pamphlets published by the Bureau of Evaluative Studies and Testing. Each pamphlet contains the published findings of a research study performed on a facet of educational evaluation. Pamphlets from the years 1969-1977 were published under the series title Indiana Studies in Prediction. Pamphlets from the years 1978-1987 were published under the series title Indiana Studies in Higher Education. Titles are arranged chronologically by publication date. A comprehensive list of all publications produced under the aforementioned series titles from 1963-1987 is also included at the end of the collection.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Additional records such as newsletters, annual reports, bulletins, and publications may be accessed in the Archives of Institutional Memory http://institutionalmemory.iu.edu/aim/

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Publications pulled from archives publications collection and added to 2010/092.

userestrict.head: Usage Restrictions
userestrict.p: Copyrights for records originating with Indiana University administrative units, departments, and other offices are held by the Trustees of Indiana University. For more information, please contact the Indiana University Archives staff.

The Indiana University Archives respects the intellectual property rights of others and does not claim any copyrights for non-university records, materials in the public domain, or materials for which we do not hold a Deed of Gift. Responsibility for the determination of the copyright status of these materials rests with those persons wishing to reuse the materials. Researchers are responsible for securing permission from copyright owners and any other rights holders for any reuse of these materials that extends beyond fair use or other statutory limitations.

Digital reproductions of archival materials from the Indiana University Archives are made available for noncommercial educational and research purposes only. If you are the copyright holder for any of the digitized materials and have questions about its inclusion on our site, please contact the Indiana University Archivist.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Item], Indiana University Bureau of Evaluative Studies and Testing publications, Collection C415, Indiana University Archives, Bloomington.
